title: Build personal calculator with basic arithmetic operations

requirements.text: Create a calculator interface with number buttons (0-9), decimal point, and clear button
acceptanceCriteria: Display shows number pad with digits 0-9
Decimal point button is present and functional
Clear button resets the calculator display to 0

requirements.text: Implement basic arithmetic operation buttons for addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
acceptanceCriteria: Addition (+) button performs correct calculations
Subtraction (-) button performs correct calculations
Multiplication (ร) button performs correct calculations
Division (รท) button performs correct calculations
Equals (=) button displays the result of the operation

requirements.text: Add a display screen that shows the current number input and calculation results
acceptanceCriteria: Display shows numbers as they are entered
Display updates to show calculation results when equals is pressed
Display handles multi-digit numbers correctly
Display shows appropriate feedback for invalid operations (e.g., division by zero)

requirements.text: Implement calculator logic to handle sequential operations and maintain calculation state
acceptanceCriteria: Calculator correctly chains multiple operations (e.g., 5 + 3 - 2 = 6)
Pressing an operation button after equals uses the previous result
Calculator handles decimal number calculations accurately
Invalid operations display appropriate error messages

requirements.text: Design a cohesive visual theme with a modern, clean aesthetic using warm earth tones (terracotta, sand, olive) with clear typography and intuitive button layouts that emphasize usability
acceptanceCriteria: Color scheme consistently uses warm earth tone palette
Typography is clear and legible for numbers and operations
Button layout follows standard calculator conventions
Visual hierarchy clearly distinguishes number buttons from operation buttons
